title: How to Make a Cookie and Cream Pie

text: Preheat the oven to 350° Fahrenheit (175° Celsius).  Combine the melted butter, sugar, and Oreo crumbs together. Mix well in a large bowl until fully combined. Press the Oreo crumb mixture onto a 10-inch pie dish. Use a rubber spatula to flatten the crumb mixture nicely all around the pie dish. Bake the pie crush for about 20 minutes. Cook until the crust sets completely. Let it cool for about 5 minutes and set aside. Beat together the half & half, cream cheese, and the boxes of pudding mix. Use an electric mixer to combine the ingredients together. Beat until the mixture is thick and smooth. Fold in the chopped candy bar pieces. Stir until well-combined. You may leave an extra two tablespoons leftover for garnish at the end. Pour the creamed mixture into the pie crust. Spread it around evenly with a rubber spatula. Spread over the thawed whipped topping and extra candy bar pieces.  Chill the pie in the fridge. Let it chill for about 4 hours till overnight. Serve. Slice a piece of pie and lay it on a serving plate. Garnish with more.
